title: @Riot. Listen. Don't touch Zoe for at the very least a month or two.

replies.body: They still haven't realized that they have way overbuffed Ornn.
I'm honestly amazed that no one made any fuss about 20% max HP damage in 2 seconds.

If it would be 2 seconds, that would be a blessing.

The fire belching just lasts 0,75 seconds, add an AA afterwards and you get 33% max health damage in 1 second time investment.

I never understood why they did this massive buff. He has too much max health damage in his kit for the amount of CC and tankiness he brings.
Yep, I'm just glad he's not as popular or I would be perma banning him every game. Definitely think they need to nerf his W dmg.

I am amazed by Riot at times.

Has anybody on the balance team ever laned against Ornn? 

The experience is quite depressing.
Balance team is consisted of hard stuck diamond 5 that got there playing only busted champs that were in meta or overbuffed at times. So basically their game knowledge is not more than silver level.
So we’ve gone from silver balance team to hard stuck diamond 5 balance team
I was thinking this same thing with all the repeated buffs. I know for a fact he is going to be P/B among tanks when pro games start up again unless something even crazier comes around

From what I understand internally, we actually think she might be a _tad_ _strong_.

So, I can see a future where, in a month or two, we will be nerfing, rather than buffing her. 

Zoe is tough, super tough, and it's going to take people a while to learn. But during this time, we are OK with future Zoe mains going 1/17/13 (within reason :P)

Again, I'm not sure if we will buff or nerf her in the upcoming months, but we are definitely taking into account the difficulty of the champion into her winrates and power.

Yeah she is tough.. she has a high damage output..

BUT...

her kit is not only very technical with multiple combos to learn.. learning to use them on the fly and what combo to use makes her probably one of the hardest champions i have ever had to learn. 

Its like when you play her you cant think straight. 

_"Do i R backwards then Q wait for pop and Q... or do i Q than R forward and Q?"_ that kind of thing. 
_Q then pop up over a wall then Q_
_Q then pop up over a wall then E or E through the wall_
_do i Q to the side then Q the enemy or do i Q back and R over and Q the enemy?_

The combinations are amazing and they take thought and planning and skill. 
and on top of all of that... the Q is very hard to hit on an enemy with a redirect because it takes so long. and 70% of them in lane ive throne have been dodged. 

So the reward for the skill shots and the forethought that goes into making her kit work... is what makes her damage justified. 


i will say that her level one potential is nasty and may need to be scaled down a bit.. look what i did at level 1 with the starting speed boost
https://goo.gl/GHTWQK

Closer enemy R backward.
 farther enemy r forward.
i cant even pretend that is a hard kit to understand or use
thats like saying trundle put down w now i can run omni directionally so he  is far harder.
no its w edge toward enemy if you need to engage w edge away from enemy if you need to retreat.  e behind enemy to engage e ahead of enemy to retreat.
zoe's q is basically viktors e in application although not in damage.

Zoe is insane, she has an infinite number of combos with an infinite number of executions, but as players (specifically Zoe Mains) get better _collectively_ (See Yasuo) and people find the optimal runes and items (Release Yasuo where people rushed IE first xp), these things will be easier  and her WR will go up. Her Q won't kill the minions early on, and even if they do that doesn't mean the projectile doesn't stop at the minions. The bonus damage on asleep targets is increased up to a cap of how much the first hit does.
Rank 2 Q with enough range is enough to oneshot the caster minions

but to get that range either all the melee minions have to be dead (which happens but by that point your wave is small enough that the enemy laner can deal), or you have to be almost perpendicular to the wave which leaves you open to getting poked and/or jumped on, especially since you a using your damage to farm instead of poke.
No, you can cast it to the side, walk up, then recast it in like a 45 degree angle, to completely dodge the melees, but hit the casters
this wouldn't get you enough distance to kill the minions, it would deal good damage but it would be about half their hp at best.
